trans-unit.source: When adding a VNet-to-VNet connection, verify that both of your virtual networks have a virtual network gateway and that your virtual networks do not have any overlapping address ranges.
trans-unit.target: When adding a VNet-to-VNet connection, verify that both of your virtual networks have a virtual network gateway and that your virtual networks do not have any overlapping address ranges.

trans-unit.source: From the **Virtual networks** blade, locate your virtual network and click to open the blade.
trans-unit.target: From the **Virtual networks** blade, locate your virtual network and click to open the blade.

trans-unit.source: On the blade, you will see your gateway listed as a *Connected device*.
trans-unit.target: On the blade, you will see your gateway listed as a *Connected device*.

trans-unit.source: You can also configure settings directly from your virtual network gateway without first expanding the VNet.
trans-unit.target: You can also configure settings directly from your virtual network gateway without first expanding the VNet.

trans-unit.source: From the virtual network gateway settings, click **Connections**, and then **Add**.
trans-unit.target: From the virtual network gateway settings, click **Connections**, and then **Add**.

trans-unit.source: For **Virtual network gateway**, the value is fixed because you are connecting from this gateway.
trans-unit.target: For **Virtual network gateway**, the value is fixed because you are connecting from this gateway.

trans-unit.source: For **Second virtual network gateway**, select the gateway you want to create a connection to from this gateway.
trans-unit.target: For **Second virtual network gateway**, select the gateway you want to create a connection to from this gateway.

trans-unit.source: The remaining values for **Subscription**, **Resource Group**, and **Location** are fixed.
trans-unit.target: The remaining values for **Subscription**, **Resource Group**, and **Location** are fixed.

trans-unit.source: You'll see *Creating Connection* flash on the screen.
trans-unit.target: You'll see *Creating Connection* flash on the screen.

trans-unit.source: When the connection is complete, you'll see it appear in the **Connections** blade for your Gateway.
trans-unit.target: When the connection is complete, you'll see it appear in the **Connections** blade for your Gateway.
